Description.Title: CanopyTemperature (EnergyBalance component)
Description.Authors: Peter D. Jamieson; Glen S. Francis; Derick R. Wilson; Robert J. Martin
Description.Institution: New Zealand Institute for Crop and Food Research Ltd.
Description.ExtendedDescription: The CanopyTemperature strategy computes minimum and maximum canopy temperature from air temperature, crop heat flux, and boundary layer conductance. It adds an advective heating term to min/max air temperature based on the ratio of crop heat flux to the bulk aerodynamic heat capacity term, using parameters for latent heat of vaporization (lambdaV), air density (rhoDensityAir), and specific heat capacity of air (specificHeatCapacityAir).
Description.ShortDescription: Computes min/max canopy temperature from crop heat flux and conductance.

Input.name: lambdaV
Input.description: latent heat of vaporization of water

Input.name: specificHeatCapacityAir
Input.description: specific heat capacity of dry air

Function.name: CalculateModel
Function.description: Compute minimal and maximal canopy temperature from crop heat flux and boundary layer conductance.
